alert.note: Alert for Jones; Shackelford; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 10:05PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN JONES...NORTHERN SHACKELFORD AND THROCKMORTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM CDT... At 1005 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Hawley, and also in northern Shackelford County, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Anson, Throckmorton, Hawley, Lueders, Woodson, Nugent, Elbert, Avoca, Fort Griffin, Funston, Us-183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line, Lusk, Lake Fort Phantom Hill, The Intersection Of Us-283 And Ranch Road 209, The Intersection Of Us- 180 And Farm Road 600, Hodges, The Intersection Of Us-183 And Us- 283, The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222, Big Country Baptist Assembly, and Truby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
